article_title: After Five Years, Dodd-Frank Is a Failure
article_text:
Tuesday will mark five years since President Obama’s signing of the Dodd-Frank law, the most sweeping rewrite of the country’s financial laws since the New Deal. Mr. Obama told the country that the legislation would “lift our economy.” The statute itself declared that it would “end too big to fail” and “promote financial stability.”

None of that has come to pass. Too-big-to-fail institutions have not disappeared. Big banks are...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Rep. Jeb Hensarling writes that after five years the Dodd-Frank law has crushed small banks, restricted access to credit, and planted the seeds of financial instability.
twitter.title: After Five Years, Dodd-Frank Is a Failure

image.alt: After Five Years, Dodd-Frank Is a Failure
